intro: Thladiantha lijiangensis, commonly known as the Lijiang goji berry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Solanaceae. It is native to the Yunnan Province in China, where it thrives in high-altitude regions with cool, temperate climates. The plant produces small, orange-red berries that are rich in antioxidants and have been used in traditional Chinese medicine. Its botanical features include hairy stems, ovate leaves, and clusters of small white flowers. Thladiantha lijiangensis is valued both for its medicinal properties and its ornamental appeal.
